symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.fiori.ProductSwitch
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-product-switch is an SAP Fiori specific web component that is used in ui5-shellbar and allows the user to easily switch between products.

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents-fiori/dist/ProductSwitch.js";

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.fiori.ProductSwitchItem
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-product-switch-item web component represents the items displayed in the ui5-product-switch web component.

Note: ui5-product-switch-item is not supported when used outside of ui5-product-switch.

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents-fiori/dist/ProductSwitchItem.js";

properties.name: heading
properties.description: Defines the title of the ui5-product-switch-item.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Defines the icon to be displayed as a graphical element within the ui5-product-switch-item.

Example: 
ui5-product-switch-item icon="palette"
See all the available icons in the Icon Explorer.

properties.name: subtitle
properties.description: Defines the subtitle of the ui5-product-switch-item.

properties.name: target
properties.description:
Defines a target where the targetSrc content must be open.

Available options are:
  • _self
  • _top
  • _blank
  • _parent
  • _search

properties.name: targetSrc
properties.description: Defines the ui5-product-switch-item target URI. Supports standard hyperlink behavior.

events.name: click
events.description: Fired when the ui5-product-switch-item is activated either with a click/tap or by using the Enter or Space key.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.fiori.ShellBar
symbols.description:
Overview

The ui5-shellbar is meant to serve as an application header and includes numerous built-in features, such as: logo, profile image/icon, title, search field, notifications and so on.

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents-fiori/dist/ShellBar";

properties.name: logo
properties.description: Defines the logo source URI.

properties.name: notificationCount
properties.description: Defines the notificationCount, displayed in the notification icon top-right corner.

properties.name: primaryTitle
properties.description:
Defines the primaryTitle.

Note: The primaryTitle would be hidden on S screen size (less than approx. 700px).

properties.name: secondaryTitle
properties.description:
Defines the secondaryTitle.

Note: The secondaryTitle would be hidden on S and M screen sizes (less than approx. 1300px).

properties.name: showCoPilot
properties.description:
Defines, if the product CoPilot icon would be displayed.
Note: By default the co-pilot is displayed as static SVG. If you need an animated co-pilot, you can import the "@ui5/webcomponents-fiori/dist/features/CoPilotAnimation.js" module as add-on feature.

properties.name: showNotifications
properties.description: Defines, if the notification icon would be displayed.

properties.name: showProductSwitch
properties.description: Defines, if the product switch icon would be displayed.

slots.name: default
slots.description:
Defines the ui5-shellbar aditional items.

Note: You can use the  <ui5-shellbar-item></ui5-shellbar-item>.

slots.name: menuItems
slots.description:
Defines the items displayed in menu after a click on the primary title.

Note: You can use the  <ui5-li></ui5-li> and its ancestors.

slots.name: profile
slots.description: You can pass ui5-avatar to set the profile image/icon. If no profile slot is set - profile will be excluded from actions.

slots.name: searchField
slots.description: Defines the ui5-input, that will be used as a search field.

slots.name: startButton
slots.description: Defines a ui5-button in the bar that will be placed in the beginning. We encourage this slot to be used for a back or home button. It gets overstyled to match ShellBar's styling.

events.name: coPilotClick

parameters.name: targetRef
parameters.description: dom ref of the activated element

events.description: Fired, when the co pilot is activated.

events.name: logoClick

parameters.name: targetRef
parameters.description: dom ref of the activated element

events.description: Fired, when the logo is activated.

events.name: menuItemClick

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: dom ref of the activated list item

events.description: Fired, when a menu item is activated Note: You can prevent closing of oveflow popover by calling event.preventDefault().

events.name: notificationsClick

parameters.name: targetRef
parameters.description: dom ref of the activated element

events.description: Fired, when the notification icon is activated.

events.name: productSwitchClick

parameters.name: targetRef
parameters.description: dom ref of the activated element

events.description: Fired, when the product switch icon is activated. Note: You can prevent closing of oveflow popover by calling event.preventDefault().

events.name: profileClick

parameters.name: targetRef
parameters.description: dom ref of the activated element

events.description: Fired, when the profile slot is present.

methods.name: closeOverflow
methods.description: Closes the overflow area. Useful to manually close the overflow after having suppressed automatic closing with preventDefault() of ShellbarItem's press event

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.fiori.ShellBarItem
symbols.description:
The ui5-shellbar-item represents a custom item, that might be added to the ui5-shellbar.

ES6 Module Import

import "@ui5/webcomponents-fiori/dist/ShellBarItem";

properties.name: count
properties.description: Defines the count displayed in the top-right corner.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Defines the name of the item's icon.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Defines the item text.

events.name: itemClick

parameters.name: targetRef
parameters.description: dom ref of the clicked element

events.description: Fired, when the item is pressed.

properties.name: Complete
properties.description: The file has been uploaded successfully.

properties.name: Error
properties.description: The file cannot be uploaded due to an error.

properties.name: Ready
properties.description: The file is awaiting an explicit command to start being uploaded.

properties.name: Uploading
properties.description: The file is currently being uploaded.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.fiori.UploadCollection
symbols.description:
Overview

This component allows you to represent files before uploading them to a server, with the help of ui5-upload-collection-item. It also allows you to show already uploaded files.

ES6 Module Import

import @ui5/webcomponents-fiori/dist/UploadCollection.js";

properties.name: mode
properties.description:
Defines the mode of the ui5-upload-collection.

Note: Available options are None, SingleSelect, MultiSelect, and Delete.

properties.name: noDataDescription
properties.description: Allows you to set your own text for the 'No data' description.

properties.name: noDataText
properties.description: Allows you to set your own text for the 'No data' text.

properties.name: noDnd
properties.description:
By default there will be drag and drop overlay shown over the ui5-upload-collection when files are dragged. If you don't intend to use drag and drop, set this property to true

Note: It is up to the application developer to add handler for drop event and handle it. ui5-upload-collection only shows an overlay.

slots.name: default
slots.description:
Defines the items of the ui5-upload-collection.
Note: Use ui5-upload-collection-item for the intended design.

events.name: fileDeleted
events.description:
Fired when the Delete button of any item is pressed.

Note: A Delete button is displayed on each item, when the ui5-upload-collection mode property is set to Delete.

events.name: selectionChange

parameters.name: selectedItems
parameters.description: An array of the selected items.

events.description: Fired when selection is changed by user interaction in SingleSelect and MultiSelect modes.

symbols.name: sap.ui.webcomponents.fiori.UploadCollectionItem
symbols.description:
Overview

A component to be used within the ui5-upload-collection.

ES6 Module Import

import @ui5/webcomponents-fiori/dist/UploadCollectionItem.js";

properties.name: file
properties.description: Holds File, associated with this item.

properties.name: fileName
properties.description: The name of the file.

properties.name: fileNameClickable
properties.description: If set to true the file name will be clickable and it will fire fileNameClick event upon click.

properties.name: noDelete
properties.description: Removes delete option from ui5-upload-collection with mode Delete for this item.

properties.name: noRetry
properties.description: Hides the retry button when uploadState property is Error.

properties.name: noTerminate
properties.description: Hides the terminate button when uploadState property is Uploading.

properties.name: progress
properties.description:
The upload progress in percentage.

Note: Expected values are in the interval [0, 100].

properties.name: uploadState
properties.description: If set to Uploading or Error, a progress indicator showing the progress is displayed. Also if set to Error, a refresh button is shown. When this icon is pressed retry event is fired. If set to Uploading, a terminate button is shown. When this icon is pressed terminate event is fired.

slots.name: default
slots.description: Hold the description of the ui5-upload-collection-item. Will be shown below the file name.

slots.name: thumbnail
slots.description:
A thumbnail, which will be shown in the beginning of the ui5-upload-collection-item.

Note: Use ui5-icon or img for the intended design.

events.name: fileNameClick
events.description:
Fired when the file name is clicked.

Note: This event is only available when fileNameClickable property is true.

events.name: rename
events.description:
Fired when the fileName property gets changed.

Note: An edit button is displayed on each item, when the ui5-upload-collection-item type property is set to Detail.

events.name: retry
events.description:
Fired when the retry button is pressed.

Note: Retry button is displayed when uploadState property is set to Error.

events.name: terminate
events.description:
Fired when the terminate button is pressed.

Note: Terminate button is displayed when uploadState property is set to Uploading.
